definition: to disperse after a happy time (idiom)/everyone enjoys themselves to the full then party breaks up
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to
a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

sentences.english: Year after graduation, seven similar gatherings, Bomb and unfocused.
sentences.chinese: 毕业后一年，七人相约聚会，尽欢而散。

sentences.english: The next year, seven people together again, still thoroughly enjoyed themselves and unfocused.
sentences.chinese: 第二年，七人再次相聚，仍尽欢而散。

definition: both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)
to have lost interest/to have had enough
to have eaten and drunk to one's heart's content
